title: Welcome to Quantum Computing
subtitle: The Future of Computation
description: Quantum computing harnesses the principles of quantum mechanics to process information in fundamentally new ways. Unlike classical computers that use bits (0 or 1), quantum computers use qubits that can exist in superposition.

title: Superposition & Entanglement
content:
Superposition allows qubits to exist in multiple states simultaneously until measured. Entanglement links qubits so the state of one instantly affects others.

Key applications:

keyTakeaway: Qubits leverage superposition and entanglement for exponential computational power.

title: Classical vs Quantum
conclusion: Qubits leverage quantum mechanics to achieve computational advantages impossible for classical systems.

question: What makes quantum computers potentially more powerful than classical computers?

options.feedback: Speed isn't the primary advantage - it's the ability to process multiple states simultaneously.

options.text: Superposition allows parallel processing of multiple states
options.feedback: Correct! Qubits in superposition can represent multiple states at once, enabling massive parallelism.
Memory size isn't the key - it's how quantum states can be manipulated and measured.
